title: 820-01041-A no picture
message:
I'm working on a 820-01041-A with no picture. I found liquid damage on a view areas of the logicboard and on the board of the display. The flex-connector on the display-board (TConn) and the flexcable was damaged/scorched on the left and right side. I changed the connector and the flex. The connector on the logicboard have no damage.

The liquid spills on the logicboard was not very badly - i cleaned it all. These are the areas ...
Along the outer edge under L7221, U7220, QA340, QA650.
Under U7800 the caps C7818 to C7846.
C7254, U7370 and R7370.

Here are my measurements ...
PP3V3_S5 = 3.35v
DP_INT_HPD = 3.3v
LCD_MUX_EN = 3.32v
PP5V_S0SW_LCD = 5.13v
PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F = 5.13
PP3V3_S0SW_LCD = 3.36v
EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN = 3.35V

Is this a display issue? Or could U9850 be the problem? I have not yet changed U9850.
Thanks for any help.

title: 820-01041-A no picture
message:
Liquid signs on CPU and GPU power supplies, not good at all.

You've said no picture.
What about USB activity and external video?
Do you get CPU/GPU voltages?

title: 820-01041-A no picture
message:
The machine is running over ext. HDMI
It‘s only no picture on the int. display

title: 820-01041-A no picture
message: If the LCD connector on the screen was liquid damaged, then U9850 is most likely dead. Replace U9850 and see if that fixes it.

title: 820-01041-A no picture
message: If you have external video, then should be a problem with Analog MUX (U9850).

title: 820-01041-A no picture
message:
Changing U9850 solved the issue - thanks.
Now only the backlight is missing - i try to fix this next.
